paragraph.paragraph:
EiffelEnvision project automatically includes any Eiffel source files and folders, for url*Cluster Nodes, automatically (see ../structure/auto_enumeration.xmlAutomatic Enumeration for more information.) Given this and the nature of project.xmlclean_separationSource Code Reuse, projects may include unwanted Eiffel source files or there may be a need to resolve url*class name clashes by excluding Eiffel source files from a url*Build.
Note: Exclusion is based on the item name alone and is per-url*cluster. It is possible to exclude an item and it subsequently excludes a number of other items. For instance, in a cluster shared_resources, there are two folders: xml_reader and binary_reader. In both folder there exists common.e. Excluding common.e from xml_reader will also exclude common.e from binary_reader, because common.e is an excluded item of shared_resources. After excluding common.e, EiffelEnvision will automatically show both editons as being excluded by changing the their icons to the excluded class icon (../../../images/icons/file_class_ex.ico). If this is an undesired consequence, url*Converting Folders to Clusters will permit the exclusion of only one instance of common.e.
To exclude Eiffel source file or entire folders, include as a result of setting the url*Include Subdirectories property on url*Cluster Nodes.

Select the folder ( ../../../images/icons/folder.ico ) or file ( ../../../images/icons/file_class_blue.ico ) and select Exclude From Project from it's context menu. Once selected the icon will change to ../../../images/icons/folder_ex.ico for folders and ../../../images/icons/file_class_ex.ico for files. When excluding folders, it and it's entire contents will be excluded.
Eiffel source files and folders may also be excluded using a url*Cluster Node's url*Excluded Items property.

In contrast to cluster_enumeration.xmlexcluding_itemExcluding Items, Eiffel source files and folder may need to be included back into projects. For all excluded items, Include In Project is available from the excluded item's context menu. Selecting Include In Project will reintroduce any Eiffel source files back into the project. Some Eiffel source files and folders cannot be included, and Include In Project will be gray out. This is because the items were excluded as part of a higher exclusion. For example, when exluding a folder containing Eiffel source files, it is not possible to include any of those Eiffel source files into the project because they were not directly excluded.
Eiffel source files and folders may also be included back using a url*Cluster Node's url*Excluded Items property.
